Celebrate civil rights with us on October 6.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

This past year has been a busy one. We helped to finally end the death penalty in New Hampshire, filed nearly 25 immigration lawsuits through our Immigrants' Rights Project, and are in federal court for a major voting rights lawsuit — and those are just three things out of many. But there's a lot more to do in the coming year.

Join us on Sunday, October 6 at 6 p.m. in Concord for our 2019 Bill of Rights Awards Dinner, where we will be honoring some of the incredible individuals and organizations doing civil rights work in New Hampshire.

2019 Bill of Rights Dinner

Join us to honor the work of individuals and organizations in New Hampshire that are standing up for civil rights and liberties.

Sunday, October 6, 6 p.m.
Grappone Center
70 Constitution Avenue
Concord, NH 03301

Purchase Tickets

This year, we will be honoring Eva Castillo, Director of the NH Alliance for Immigrants and Refugees, the NH Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty, and Caroline Casey and Maggie Flaherty, plaintiffs in our voting rights case.

We certainly hope you and your civil liberties-friendly family and friends can join us! All proceeds support our legal program, the only one in New Hampshire devoted exclusively to defending citizens' rights.

Get your tickets today.

We look forward to seeing you there,

Devon Chaffee
Executive Director, ACLU of New Hampshire
